'either' is followed by AdjP 'underspecified...any further', whereas 'or' is followed by a 'that'-clause. Making them parallel would not improve readability. I recommend using two sentences. 'It may be that.... Alternatively, it may be that...'
(maybe a job for the typesetters)
insert space after hyphen to allow linebreak?

'either' is followed by VP whose subject is 'that', whereas 'or' is followed by an entire clause with subject 'this feature'. I recommend 'for which the [Participant] feature either does not exist in their featural make-up or is present but unspecified'.
